lines.title: StaggerText is a React Component for creating staggered text animations when the text is in viewport. You can stagger word by word, like this.
Or you can stagger letter by letter, like this.

intro.lead: You like Staggered text animations? Well, then this library might be for you. StaggerText is a React component that transitions in text either word-by-word, or letter-by-letter, as the text enters viewport. Being a component and all, it has some options that we're gonna talk about... right now.

features.title: üìå Features
items: Built in Typescript / first class Types support
Wraps words or letters inside spans so we can sequenly fade in each span.
Animations are triggered when text is in viewport, via Intersection Observer
Options exist for animation start, start delay, and stagger duration, delay, and easing.
Callback for when animation is complete

quickStart.title: üéØ Quick Start
quickStart.install: Simply install the package from npm
quickStart.use: Now import StaggerText, provide some text, pass in a few options/props if you'd like. Text staggers in word-by-word as default.

optionsTable.description: Intersection Observer value between 0 and 1 representing the percentage component must be visible before stagger starts.
Defines if stagger animation is by word or letter
Custom easing to stagger transition-based animation
Callback when stagger animation fully completes
React children for providing text as string

items.title: Smooth transitions
items.content: For smoother, less chopy transitions, favor longer staggerDuration and shorter staggerDelay. For example, StaggerDuration={0.7} StaggerDelay={0.09} provides a nice smooth effect by word. Perhaps reduce the duration a tad for letters.

items.title: Stagger a series of lines sequentially
items.content: The stagger a series of lines, wrap each line in a component instances and leverage the onStaggerComplete callback and shouldStart prop. Ideally, you can do this dynamically with some data defining your text and prop config and useState. See a complete example above.
